pullrequest.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

content.raw:
I've been stress-testing the world_remove test on my desktop, and I found a backtrace after 41 successful runs. I've uploaded it to a gist:

* https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5429a14e236500417de022dde312e0a5

It looks like it fails in [TopicManager::ProcessNodes](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5429a14e236500417de022dde312e0a5#file-backtrace-txt-L19) while [Scene::Clear](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5429a14e236500417de022dde312e0a5#file-full_backtrace-txt-L265) is called in a separate thread. Maybe there's a missing mutex lock? I believe I saw the [same failure when reviewing](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2515/dont-shut-down-gazebo-when-removing-a/activity#comment-32815770) `worldless_7`
content.html:
I've been stress-testing the world_remove test on my desktop, and I found a backtrace after 41 successful runs. I've uploaded it to a gist:

  • https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5429a14e236500417de022dde312e0a5

It looks like it fails in TopicManager::ProcessNodes while Scene::Clear is called in a separate thread. Maybe there's a missing mutex lock? I believe I saw the same failure when reviewing worldless_7

pullrequest.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

content.raw:
I think I have a fix for the `Scene::Clear` and `TopicManager::ProcessNodes` backtrace I have been seeing. I noticed that the message containers are cleared before the subscribers, so I changed the order and added some mutexes for good measure in db1771d. After further testing, I saw some seg-faults in PhysicsIface, so I added a pointer check before dereferencing in aa67243

I ran the test over 250 times without a backtrace with these changes (in branch `worldless_scpeters`), so it's looking pretty good to me. Please consider merging with branch.
content.html:
I think I have a fix for the Scene::Clear and TopicManager::ProcessNodes backtrace I have been seeing. I noticed that the message containers are cleared before the subscribers, so I changed the order and added some mutexes for good measure in db1771d. After further testing, I saw some seg-faults in PhysicsIface, so I added a pointer check before dereferencing in aa67243

I ran the test over 250 times without a backtrace with these changes (in branch worldless_scpeters), so it's looking pretty good to me. Please consider merging with branch.

What I meant was, I would expect scene to be null even if we change to a GPU job

content.raw:
this would only run the test if a gpu is present:

~~~
diff -r 1e0b9c165e43 test/integration/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/integration/CMakeLists.txt   Thu Feb 08 12:55:15 2018 -0800
+++ b/test/integration/CMakeLists.txt   Fri Feb 09 01:18:44 2018 -0800
@@ -105,7 +105,6 @@
   world_entity_below_point.cc
   world_playback.cc
   world_population.cc
-  world_remove.cc
   worlds_installed.cc
   )
 
@@ -169,6 +168,7 @@
   speed_pr2.cc
   visual.cc
   wideanglecamera_sensor.cc
+  world_remove.cc
   world_reset.cc
 )
 gz_build_dri_tests(${dri_tests} EXTRA_LIBS gazebo_test_fixture)
~~~
content.html:
this would only run the test if a gpu is present:

diff -r 1e0b9c165e43 test/integration/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/integration/CMakeLists.txt   Thu Feb 08 12:55:15 2018 -0800
+++ b/test/integration/CMakeLists.txt   Fri Feb 09 01:18:44 2018 -0800
@@ -105,7 +105,6 @@
   world_entity_below_point.cc
   world_playback.cc
   world_population.cc
-  world_remove.cc
   worlds_installed.cc
   )

@@ -169,6 +168,7 @@
   speed_pr2.cc
   visual.cc
   wideanglecamera_sensor.cc
+  world_remove.cc
   world_reset.cc
 )
 gz_build_dri_tests(${dri_tests} EXTRA_LIBS gazebo_test_fixture)

pullrequest.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> 8

content.html:
Making this method const will break ABI because const is part of the symbol name, but I think it is safe to add an additional method that is const.

i.e.

      /// \brief Get whether there's at least one sensor container running.
      /// \return True if running.
      public: bool Running();

      /// \brief Get whether there's at least one sensor container running.
      /// \return True if running.
      public: bool Running() const;
